private_information: I am free the entire day on Monday
ronald.goal: Attend a 30 minute meeting on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 with all participants.

stephen.goal: Attend a 30 minute meeting on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 with all participants.

brittany.goal: Attend a 30 minute meeting on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 with all participants.

dorothy.goal: Attend a 30 minute meeting on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 with all participants.

rebecca.goal: Attend a 30 minute meeting on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 with all participants.

jordan.goal: Attend a 30 minute meeting on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 with all participants.

orchestrator.goal: Orchestrate and produce a combined PDDL plan that schedules a 30 minute meeting on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 that fits all participants' availability.

public_information: The meeting to schedule is 30 minutes long on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00.
All six participants must attend the same meeting.
Times are expressed in 30 minute granularity within work hours.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with PDDL problems (Planning Domain Definition Language). You always provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file to solve the scheduling task. Target FastDownwards PDDL solver. You always enclose the pddl domain between <domain></domain> tags and the pddl problem between <problem></problem> tags.
pddl.prompt: Your name is ronald. You are in an environment with the following public information: {environment->public_information} You have the following knowledge: {agents->ronald->private_information} This is the global goal to solve: {agents->ronald->goal} Think step by step and provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file for FastDownwards that models your availability and the meeting requirements. If you miss some information, do not make assumptions, just give a plan that concerns the information you have. Enclose the pddl domain between <domain></domain> tags and the pddl problem between <problem></problem> tags.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with multi-agent PDDL problems (Planning Domain Definition Language). You always provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file to solve the task. Target FastDownwards PDDL solver. You always enclose the pddl domain between <domain></domain> tags and the pddl problem between <problem></problem> tags. If there are multiple agents, you keep their actions distinct.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. There are six agents planning to solve a scheduling task. You will receive their PDDL domains and problems. You have to integrate them to schedule a single 30 minute meeting on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 that fits all participants. Keep in mind that the PDDL they send may be partial or contain ambiguities. A partial PDDL may partially model availability. Ambiguities may appear as different names for the same time slot. Here is the information the first agent sent: {pddl_ronald} Here is the information the second agent sent: {pddl_stephen} Here is the information the third agent sent: {pddl_brittany} Here is the information the fourth agent sent: {pddl_dorothy} Here is the information the fifth agent sent: {pddl_rebecca} Here is the information the sixth agent sent: {pddl_jordan} Integrate the PDDL responses and produce a combined PDDL domain and PDDL problem for FastDownwards that keeps actions of each participant distinct and results in a valid schedule for all. Enclose the pddl domain between <domain></domain> tags and the pddl problem between <problem></problem> tags.
